intro: Anthopterus molaui, commonly known as the Malagasy orchid, is a species of orchid native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery), while its roots are adapted for nutrient absorption in poor soil. Anthopterus molaui plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is a subject of interest for botanical research.
